fine_dining.name: La Grande Maison de Bernard Magrez
signature_dishes: Foie gras with Sauternes jelly and aged balsamic
Roasted pigeon with Périgord truffles and potato purée
Lobster with vanilla-infused sauce
fine_dining.atmosphere: Elegant and refined with art-filled interiors and garden views
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book at least one month in advance, request wine pairing. The restaurant offers a unique wine cellar experience.
fine_dining.local_tips: The wine list is exceptional with over 1,000 references. Ask the sommelier for rare Bordeaux vintages.

fine_dining.name: Le Pressoir d'Argent
signature_dishes: Blue lobster with caviar and citrus emulsion
Aquitaine caviar with blinis and crème fraîche
Turbot with wild mushrooms and truffle sauce
fine_dining.atmosphere: Luxurious and sophisticated with crystal chandeliers and river views
fine_dining.booking_tips: Reservations open two months in advance, book early for weekend dining
fine_dining.local_tips: Request a table with a view of the open kitchen. The restaurant is located in the historic Grand Hôtel de Bordeaux.

fine_dining.name: Le Chapon Fin
signature_dishes: Duck foie gras terrine with fig chutney
Lamb from the Pyrenees with seasonal vegetables
Chocolate soufflé with vanilla ice cream
fine_dining.atmosphere: Historic and elegant with rock cave-like décor dating from 1825
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book at least two weeks in advance, lunch is a better value. The restaurant offers a unique historical atmosphere.
fine_dining.local_tips: Ask about the history of this 1825 restaurant while dining. The wine list features excellent Bordeaux selections.

fine_dining.name: Château Cordeillan-Bages
signature_dishes: Pauillac lamb with herbs and red wine reduction
Seasonal truffle dishes with local mushrooms
Cheese selection from local affineurs
fine_dining.atmosphere: Refined château setting with vineyard views and elegant dining rooms
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book at least three weeks in advance, inquire about seasonal menu and wine pairings
fine_dining.local_tips: Combine with a visit to Château Lynch-Bages winery. The restaurant offers wine tasting experiences.

fine_dining.name: Le Saint-James
signature_dishes: Roasted langoustine with citrus and herbs
Beef from Bazas with Bordelaise sauce
Seasonal fruit desserts with local honey
fine_dining.atmosphere: Contemporary and sleek with panoramic views of Bordeaux from the hills
fine_dining.booking_tips: Reserve a window table for the best views of Bordeaux. The restaurant is located in a modern hotel complex.
fine_dining.local_tips: Stay for sunset if dining in the evening for spectacular views. The restaurant offers cooking classes.

casual_dining.name: La Tupina
signature_dishes: Roast chicken in the fireplace with herbs
Duck confit with potatoes cooked in duck fat
Cèpes mushrooms with garlic and parsley
casual_dining.atmosphere: Rustic and authentic with a large open fireplace and traditional décor
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book a week in advance, especially on weekends. The restaurant is popular with locals and tourists alike.
casual_dining.local_tips: Try the house specialty of potatoes cooked in duck fat. The restaurant sources ingredients from local producers.
casual_dining.address: 6 Rue Porte de la Monnaie, 33000 Bordeaux

casual_dining.name: Le Bistrot du Gabriel
signature_dishes: Steak tartare with hand-cut fries
Duck magret with seasonal vegetables
Crème brûlée with vanilla from Madagascar
casual_dining.atmosphere: Classic bistro with views of Place de la Bourse and outdoor terrace
casual_dining.booking_tips: Request a terrace table in nice weather. The restaurant offers excellent people watching.
casual_dining.local_tips: The lunch menu is excellent value for the quality. Try the daily specials.

casual_dining.name: Brasserie Bordelaise
signature_dishes: Entrecôte steak with Bordelaise sauce
Oysters from Arcachon Bay with shallot vinegar
Tarte Tatin with vanilla ice cream
casual_dining.atmosphere: Lively and bustling with wooden décor and traditional brasserie feel
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book a few days ahead, especially on weekends. The restaurant is popular for business lunches.
casual_dining.local_tips: Their meat selection is excellent, sourced from local farms. The wine list features regional selections.

casual_dining.name: Le Petit Commerce
signature_dishes: Seafood platter with local oysters and shrimp
Grilled fish of the day with herbs
Mussels marinières with white wine and shallots
casual_dining.atmosphere: Cozy and maritime with fresh seafood displays and nautical décor
casual_dining.booking_tips: Reserve in advance for dinner, lunch may be walk-in. The restaurant is popular for seafood lovers.
casual_dining.local_tips: Ask what came in fresh that day for the best experience. The restaurant sources from local fishermen.

casual_dining.name: Miles
signature_dishes: Tasting menu (changes regularly with seasonal ingredients)
Seasonal desserts with local fruits
Wine pairing with local and international selections
casual_dining.atmosphere: Modern and intimate with an open kitchen and contemporary décor
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book at least a week in advance. The restaurant offers a unique fusion experience.
casual_dining.local_tips: Opt for the chef's surprise menu for the full experience. The restaurant focuses on seasonal ingredients.

casual_dining.name: Le Chien de Pavlov
signature_dishes: Beef cheek stew with red wine reduction
Fresh fish carpaccio with citrus and herbs
Chocolate fondant with vanilla ice cream
casual_dining.atmosphere: Trendy and relaxed with contemporary decor and artistic touches
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book a few days in advance. The restaurant is popular with young professionals.
casual_dining.local_tips: Their wine list features excellent small local producers. The restaurant offers creative interpretations of classic dishes.
casual_dining.address: 25 Rue du Dr Albert Barraud, 33000 Bordeaux

casual_dining.name: Fufu
signature_dishes: Gyoza with local ingredients
Ramen with seasonal vegetables and local broth
Matcha desserts with French pastry techniques
casual_dining.atmosphere: Casual and minimalist with Japanese aesthetics and modern touches
casual_dining.booking_tips: No reservations, arrive early to avoid waiting. The restaurant is popular for quick lunches.
casual_dining.local_tips: Try their daily specials, which often incorporate seasonal local produce. The restaurant offers a unique fusion experience.
casual_dining.address: 12 Rue du Dr Albert Barraud, 33000 Bordeaux

casual_dining.name: Karl
signature_dishes: Seasonal vegetable dishes with local produce
Creative meat preparations with modern techniques
Artisanal bread and butter
casual_dining.atmosphere: Relaxed and modern with simple decor and focus on food quality
casual_dining.booking_tips: Reservations recommended for dinner. The restaurant offers a casual dining experience.
casual_dining.local_tips: The blackboard menu changes daily based on market finds. The restaurant sources from local farmers.
casual_dining.address: 8 Rue du Dr Albert Barraud, 33000 Bordeaux

street_food.name: Marché des Capucins
specialties: Oysters from Arcachon Bay with white wine
street_food.local_tips: Visit Jean-Jean oyster stand for fresh oysters with white wine. The market is busiest on Sunday mornings.

street_food.name: Rue Sainte-Catherine
specialties: Crepes with sweet and savory fillings
Pastries and desserts from local bakeries
street_food.local_tips: Try the sweet buckwheat crepes with salted caramel. The street offers diverse food options.

street_food.name: Baserriko Food Truck
street_food.local_tips: Check their social media for current location. The truck offers authentic Basque cuisine.

street_food.name: Darwin Ecosystem
specialties: Organic street food with local ingredients
street_food.local_tips: Visit on Sundays when local producers set up market stalls. The venue offers a unique sustainable dining experience.

street_food.name: Mampuku
specialties: Japanese street food with local twists
street_food.local_tips: Small plates meant for sharing, order a variety. The restaurant offers authentic Japanese street food.

coffee_shops.name: L'Alchimiste
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Modern and minimalist with focus on coffee craft and quality
coffee_shops.food_options: Pastries and light snacks from local bakeries
coffee_shops.local_tips: Talk to the baristas about beans, they're very knowledgeable. The café offers coffee brewing workshops.
coffee_shops.address: 8 Rue du Dr Albert Barraud, 33000 Bordeaux

coffee_shops.name: Café Piha
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Bright and airy with surf-inspired decor and relaxed vibe
coffee_shops.food_options: Full brunch menu and homemade cakes with local ingredients
coffee_shops.local_tips: Great spot for remote workers, with plenty of plugs. The café offers a unique Australian coffee experience.
coffee_shops.address: 12 Rue du Dr Albert Barraud, 33000 Bordeaux

coffee_shops.name: Café Naima
coffee_shops.specialty: Coffee and jazz with artistic atmosphere
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Cozy and artistic with jazz records and live music events
coffee_shops.food_options: Light vegetarian fare with local ingredients
coffee_shops.local_tips: Check their schedule for jazz nights and events. The café offers a unique cultural experience.
coffee_shops.address: 15 Rue du Dr Albert Barraud, 33000 Bordeaux

coffee_shops.name: Black List Café
must_try: Nitro cold brew with smooth texture
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Industrial chic with specialty coffee equipment and modern décor
coffee_shops.food_options: Pastries from local bakeries and light snacks
coffee_shops.local_tips: They sell beans and brewing equipment for home use. The café offers coffee education classes.
coffee_shops.address: 18 Rue du Dr Albert Barraud, 33000 Bordeaux

coffee_shops.name: Horace Café
coffee_shops.specialty: Coffee and natural wine with sophisticated atmosphere
must_try: Natural wine by the glass with local selections
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Trendy and relaxed with wine shop attached and knowledgeable staff
coffee_shops.food_options: Cheese and charcuterie plates with local products
coffee_shops.local_tips: Transitions from café to wine bar in the evening. The venue offers unique coffee and wine experiences.
coffee_shops.address: 22 Rue du Dr Albert Barraud, 33000 Bordeaux

bars.name: Le Bar à Vin CIVB
signature_drinks: Grand Cru flights with tasting notes
Bordeaux blanc with local cheese pairings
Rare vintage wines by the glass
bars.atmosphere: Elegant and historic with stained glass windows and wine cellar atmosphere
bars.food_options: Cheese and charcuterie platters with local products
bars.local_tips: Excellent place to try premium wines at reasonable prices. The bar offers wine education sessions.

bars.name: Night Beach
bars.atmosphere: Upscale and trendy with panoramic city views and sophisticated décor
bars.food_options: Tapas and light bites with modern presentations
bars.local_tips: Reserve in advance for the best tables with city views. The bar offers a unique rooftop experience.

bars.name: La Comtesse
signature_drinks: Seasonal fruit cocktails with fresh ingredients
bars.atmosphere: Intimate and vintage with boudoir-style decor and sophisticated ambiance
bars.food_options: Small tapas selection with creative presentations
bars.local_tips: Ask the bartenders for off-menu creations. The bar offers a unique vintage atmosphere.
bars.address: 25 Rue du Dr Albert Barraud, 33000 Bordeaux

bars.name: Symbiose
signature_drinks: Smoked whiskey cocktails with local spirits
bars.atmosphere: Secret and sophisticated with garden terrace and intimate setting
bars.food_options: Modern tapas menu with creative presentations
bars.local_tips: Enter through the café in front, reservations recommended. The bar offers a unique speakeasy experience.
bars.address: 28 Rue du Dr Albert Barraud, 33000 Bordeaux

bars.name: La Guinguette Chez Alriq
bars.specialty: Local wines and craft beer with river views
signature_drinks: Local craft beer from regional breweries
bars.atmosphere: Rustic and lively with riverside setting and outdoor seating
bars.food_options: Grilled dishes and shareable plates with local ingredients
bars.local_tips: Check their schedule for live music events, especially in summer. The venue offers a unique riverside experience.

bars.name: Le Point Rouge
bars.atmosphere: Elegant and mysterious with speakeasy vibes and sophisticated décor
bars.food_options: Upscale bar snacks with creative presentations
bars.local_tips: Tell the bartender your preferences for a custom cocktail. The bar offers a unique personalized experience.
bars.address: 30 Rue du Dr Albert Barraud, 33000 Bordeaux

food_tours.name: Bordeaux Wine Trails
food_tours.focus: Wine and food pairing with expert guidance
highlights: Historic wine cellars and production facilities
food_tours.booking_tips: Book at least a week in advance, especially during summer. The tour includes transportation and expert guides.

food_tours.name: Taste of Bordeaux Market Tour
food_tours.focus: Local market experience with culinary insights
food_tours.booking_tips: Morning tours are best to see the market in full swing. The tour includes tastings and market purchases.

food_tours.name: Gourmet Bordeaux Walking Tour
food_tours.focus: Classic Bordeaux cuisine with historical context
food_tours.booking_tips: Book early for weekend tours as they fill up quickly. The tour includes historical context and tastings.

food_tours.name: Saint-Émilion Food & Wine Experience
food_tours.focus: Vineyard and village gastronomy with expert guidance
food_tours.booking_tips: Reserve at least two weeks in advance during high season. The tour includes transportation and expert guides.

cooking_classes.name: Cook & Go Bordeaux
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Book at least one week in advance for weekend classes. The classes include hands-on cooking experience.

cooking_classes.name: Château Cooking Experience
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Book well in advance, these exclusive classes fill quickly. The experience includes château accommodation options.

cooking_classes.name: L'Atelier des Chefs
cooking_classes.cuisine_focus: Modern French techniques with local ingredients
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Shorter lunch express classes available on weekdays. The classes focus on practical cooking skills.

markets.name: Marché des Capucins
markets.type: Covered food market with local specialties
highlights: Oyster bars with fresh Arcachon Bay oysters
markets.local_tips: Have breakfast at Pata Negra for incredible local ham. The market is busiest on Sunday mornings.

markets.name: Marché des Quais
markets.local_tips: Bring your own bags and arrive hungry for samples. The market offers beautiful river views.

markets.name: Marché de Saint-Michel
highlights: Street food with local and international flavors
markets.local_tips: Great spot for North African and Mediterranean specialties. The market reflects Bordeaux's diverse population.

spring: White asparagus with Hollandaise sauce from Landes
Strawberries from Lot-et-Garonne with local cream
Young Bordeaux wines with fresh goat cheese
summer: Tomato and Basque pepper salad with local olive oil
Lamprey à la Bordelaise with red wine sauce
Fresh oysters from Arcachon Bay with white wine
autumn: Cepes (porcini) mushrooms with garlic and parsley
Duck confit with potatoes cooked in duck fat
Bordeaux harvest celebrations with new vintage wines
winter: Black truffles from Périgord with pasta dishes
Entrecôte à la Bordelaise with red wine reduction
Cassoulet with local beans and duck confit
